thread.title: NYPD ‘patrol pig’ hams it up downtown
thread.title_full: NYPD ‘patrol pig’ hams it up downtown | New York Post

author: Gabrielle Fonrouge
title: NYPD ‘patrol pig’ hams it up downtown
text:
He’s New York’s Swinest.
This tiny porker oinked his way into the hearts of two NYPD cops on patrol in lower Manhattan.
Police officers seen posing for a photo with little pig. Splash News Officer Grid Troci and another cop were outside the Apple Store in Soho when two people walked by with a pet pig on a bright red leash wearing an NYPD jacket.
The cops took the piglet’s leash and laughed about their new porcine pal.
The pig’s owners then asked Troci to pose for a picture — and he took the little guy in his hands and smiled wide.
Troci wasn’t the only swine swooner — the piglet was spotted in various ­Instagram photos taken by enamored New Yorkers who saw it walking around town.
Keeping a pet pig in a home is illegal in the city but it’s OK to walk it around.
The violation falls under the city’s health code, which police aren’t ­required to enforce.
Troci has worked as a Neighborhood Coordination Officer and is known for his work doing community policing.
